intro: Haemadictyon nutans var. maximum, commonly known as the drooping nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Urticaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving them a velvety texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on long, drooping peduncles. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. This variant is notable for its unique morphology and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
